item.title: Drink More....Water that is!
item.description: Are you thirsty? Your body probably is. Put the bunny in the box, take the water out. Water comprises the majority of our bodyweight (both as infants and adults), and we consume it in a variety of ways (soft, hard, spring, well, carbonated and distilled), and not just directly but indirectly from food, and (to a lesser extent), from oxidation of macronutrients (metabolic water)[^1]. Despite this, it is estimated that around 75% of Americans are chronically dehydrated[^2].

item.title: Neti for your health
item.description: Winter’s the season for the sniffles. Combine that with the COVID pandemic that has put a strain on the healthcare system, and prevention of common ailments is becoming extremely important for us all. Luckily there is a simple solution to lessen the severity of (and in some cases prevent) these conditions. Disclaimer: I am not a medical professional, and although will be providing links to medical resources and practices, this does not replace professional medical advice.

item.title: You need a break
item.description: The problem Have a look at these sayings and clichés: “The hustle and bustle” “Busy-bees” “Eager-beaver” “The early bird gets the worm” “Leave no stone unturned” “Idle hands are the devils playground” “To fill the unforgiving minute” “Keep up with the Jones” Our society is built around non-stop activity, forward movement, and full-throttle energy. Need energy? There’s coffee. Hate coffee, we have soda. Need something stronger? What about a high sugar/high caffeine energy drink?
